original: Larsson, Karl Martin, läroverksadjunkt, Göteborg, f. 1/6/94 i Fäglum, Skarab. 1., av Lars Gustafsson o. h. h., f. Johansson, G. 25 m. lär. Frida Maria Danielsson. Barn: Helge f. 27, Ragnar 29. — FoJkskoll :ex. 18, stud:-ex. 22, fil. kand. 24, fil. mag. 27, fil. lic. samt provår 34 i Gbg. E. o. folkskoll. i Uddevalla 18, Falköp. 19, ord. där 20-22, ord. lär. v. Gbgs folksk. m. tjg även v. högre avd. 22-36, e. o. ämnesiär. v. Gbgs komm. mellansk. 33, e. lär. o. vik. adj. v. Gbgs h. latin 34-36, adj. i modersm. o. hist. m. sam-h :lära v. Gbgs östra real -sed. 36, tillika bibi. där sed. 39, adj. i samma ämnen samt geogr. v. h. a. 1. f. fl. i Gbg 47, timlärare vid Gbgs enskilda gymn. för blivande präster sed. 35, timlär. i ^svenska v. Fören. f. hand:-kunsk. befrämj. sed. 36, sekr. i Pedag. sällsk. i Gbg sed. 37. Arkivstud. i upps., Sthlm o. Lund m. anslag ur Henrik Ahrenbergs fond 29 o. 3L Uppdr. av stat. lärob :nd att granska lärob. i hist. Skr.: ett ant. upps. i skolhistoria.
translated: Larsson, Karl Martin, high school teacher, Gothenburg, born on June 1, 1894 in Fäglum, Skaraborg. Son of Lars Gustafsson and his wife Johansson, G. Married to Frida Maria Danielsson. Children: Helge, born in 1927, Ragnar, born in 1929. Completed primary school examination in 1918, studied at the university from 1922, obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1924, Master of Arts degree in 1927, Licentiate of Philosophy degree, and completed a probationary year in Gothenburg in 1934. Worked as a substitute teacher in primary schools in Uddevalla in 1918, Falköping in 1919, and became a regular teacher there from 1920 to 1922. Became a regular teacher at Gothenburg primary school with additional duties at the higher level from 1922 to 1936. Worked as a temporary subject instructor at Gothenburg municipal middle school in 1933, substitute teacher and temporary adjunct at Gothenburg high school for Latin from 1934 to 1936, high school teacher in Swedish and history with social studies at Gothenburg East Secondary School since 1936, and also a librarian there since 1939. Adjunct teacher in the same subjects and geography at Gothenburg Adult Education Association from 1947 and hourly teacher at Gothenburg Private Gymnasium for future priests since 1935. Hourly teacher in Swedish at the Association for the Promotion of Business Knowledge since 1936 and secretary in the Pedagogical Society in Gothenburg since 1937. Conducted archival studies in Uppsala, Stockholm, and Lund with funding from Henrik Ahrenberg's fund in 1929 and 1931. Commissioned by the state educational board to review history textbooks. Written several research papers in the field of school history.

worksFor.name: Gothenburg Private Gymnasium for Future Priests
